hotspots.label: Insect Exoskeleton
hotspots.fact: This brown insect has a hard outer shell called an exoskeleton that protects its body like armor. As it grows, the insect must shed this shell and grow a new, bigger one!

hotspots.label: Lichen Growth
hotspots.fact: The green, crusty patches are lichens, which are living organisms made of fungi and algae working together. Lichens grow very slowly and can live for hundreds of years!

hotspots.label: Tree Bark
hotspots.fact: The gray and brown crumbly surface is tree bark, which protects the living wood inside. Bark also provides a home for many tiny creatures like insects and fungi.

hotspots.label: Camouflage
hotspots.fact: The insect's brown color helps it blend in with the bark and lichen around it. This hiding strategy called camouflage helps protect the insect from predators that hunt by sight.
